overview_description: Blender is a free and open-source 3D creation suite that supports the entirety of the 3D pipelineâ€”modeling, rigging, animation, simulation, rendering, compositing, and motion tracking. It's a comprehensive 3D graphics application used by artists, designers, animators, and game developers worldwide. As a complete 3D content creation software, Blender serves professional studios, independent artists, and hobbyists worldwide. The software continues to evolve with regular updates and community-driven development.
main_functions: Rendering with multiple engines (Cycles, EEVEE, Workbench)
supported_file_formats: Import/Export: OBJ, FBX, COLLADA, 3DS, PLY, STL
Image formats: PNG, JPEG, TIFF, EXR, HDR
Video formats: AVI, MO: FBX, OBJ, DAE, 3DS, PLY, STL, USD
Export: FBX, OBJ, glTF 2.0, Alembic, USD
system_requirements: Available for Windows, macOS, and Linux
Minimum: 64-bit dual-core 2Ghz CPU, 8GB RAM, OpenGL 3.3 compatible graphics
Recommended: Multi-core CPU, 32GB+ RAM, dedicated GPU (NVIDIA/AMD)
installation_setup: Available for Windows, macOS, and Linux
Blender can be downloaded from the official website (blender.org) with platform-specific installers
Alternative installation methods include Steam, Microsoft Store, and package managers for Linux distributions
The software offers portable installation options for Windows users
key_features: Grease Pencil for 2D animation in 3D space
Advanced modeling tools with non-destructive workflows
Powerful sculpting capabilities with dynamic topology
Comprehensive animation system with graph editor
plugin_extension_support: Blender supports extensive add-on ecosystem through built-in add-on manager and third-party marketplaces
Popular add-ons include Hard Ops, BoxCutter, Animation Nodes, and specialized tools for different industries
The Python API enables custom tool development and automation scripts
user_interface_overview: Multiple editor types (3D Viewport, Outliner, Properties)
Blender 4.0+ features a modern, customizable interface with workspace-based organization
The UI includes 3D viewport, properties panel, outliner, timeline, and specialized editors
Interface themes and layouts can be customized for different workflows and user preferences
community_tutorials: Active forums and social media presence
Blender boasts one of the largest 3D software communities with extensive tutorial resources, forums, and user-generated content
Educational resources include Blender Guru, CG Cookie, and official Blender tutorials
The annual Blender Conference showcases community achievements and development roadmap
licensing: GNU General Public License v2+ (free and open source) - GNU General Public License v3 (GPL) - Free and Open Source
latest_version_release_date: Regular quarterly releases with LTS versions every 2 years - Blender 4.5 LTS (July 2025) with planned releases including Blender 5.0 in November 2025
example_projects_outputs: Animated short films and feature productions
